text:
When authentication mechanism is handled by Apache, and brokered to Tomcat via
AJP13, Principal object is not set.  Request.getRemoteUser() returns correct
user, but Request.getUserPrincipal() returns null object.
creator: bryana@ilm.com
cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
Added a quick fix, but real integration for auth is unlikely in 3.3 "basic".
An add-on module ( like the future j-t-c ) should fix it ( for example
roles are not supported ).

The official answer is that the only supported mode is with tomcat doing all
the auth ( by forwarding all requests to tomcat). Doing the auth on apache is 
a good idea ( if you know how :-), but there is a big impedance difference
between servlet view of auth and apache.
